title: The story behind these colorful icicles in the Berkshires
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Colorful icicles on Route 2 in North Adams are created with food coloring by locals.
The tradition of coloring icicles has been practiced for decades in North Adams.
The Hairpin Turn, built in 1914, offers panoramic views and has historic significance.

title: Mass. reports first two measles cases of 2026, including one in Greater Boston
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Massachusetts confirmed its first two measles cases of 2026, involving a Greater Boston adult and a school-aged child.
The Greater Boston adult visited several locations while infectious; health officials are alerting potentially exposed individuals.
The U.S. has recorded 1,136 measles cases in 2026; high vaccination rates in Massachusetts keep local risk low.

title: Local obituary: Morgan Mallard-Vitiello, 33, lifelong South Boston resident and mother of 2
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Morgan Mallard-Vitiello, 33, of South Boston, passed away on February 21, 2026, following a brief illness.
Survived by husband Francis Vitiello and children Mya and Frankie, she was known for her vibrant spirit and community ties.
Visitation on March 3 at George F. Doherty & Sons; funeral at St. Mary of the Assumption on March 4.

title: She’s running Boston for The ALS Association in memory of her dad
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Lauren Hamilton, 26, from Tampa, Florida, will run the 2026 Boston Marathon in memory of her father.
Hamilton's father, a Boston salesman, passed away from ALS, inspiring her to advocate for ALS awareness and research.
She aims to honor her father's legacy and support families affected by ALS through her marathon participation.

title: DiZoglio files emergency motion after AG Campbell moves to strike down audit lawsuit
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: State Auditor Diana DiZoglio filed an emergency motion in response to AG Andrea Campbell's attempt to strike down her lawsuit.
DiZoglio sued legislative leaders to enforce compliance with an audit following a voter-approved measure supporting legislative audits.
AG Campbell argues DiZoglio lacks authority to sue, while legislative leaders claim the audit could breach separation of powers laws.

title: This speech-language therapist is running Boston to fund autism support services
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Carrie Kerstein, 40, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon to support the Doug Flutie Jr. Foundation for Autism.
Kerstein, a Cambridge-based speech-language therapist, aims to fundraise for autism services like speech-language therapy.
Her marathon participation aligns with her professional work to empower autistic individuals and foster community inclusion.

title: The City of Boston handed residents $2.2M to decide funding. Here’s what they picked.
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Boston allocated $2.2 million for participatory budgeting, funding projects on immigrant legal defense, food access, and housing stability.
Over 4,800 Boston residents voted on proposals, including workforce training and youth financial literacy, between Jan. 15 and Feb. 15.
Winning initiatives will begin receiving funding in spring, with relevant city departments overseeing implementation, coordinated by the Office of Participatory Budgeting.

title: Someone allegedly struck her ex’s new girlfriend with a car in Newton. Now both women are facing charges.
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Rosa Sanchez, 37, is accused of attempting to kill Exneiry Pimentel-Lugo, 22, by striking her with a car in Newton.
Both women face assault charges after a street altercation involving a baseball bat and allegations of attempted murder.
Sanchez and Pimentel-Lugo pleaded not guilty and are ordered to stay apart, with a court date set for March 23.

title: Two Boston startups join the race to create the next major weight-loss drug
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Vivtex partners with Novo Nordisk to develop oral obesity drugs, earning potential royalties of up to $2.1 billion.
Vivtex's technology uses AI to test drug absorption in the digestive system, aiming to improve oral biologics delivery.
Nimbus Therapeutics collaborates with Eli Lilly on oral obesity treatments, with agreements valued up to $1.3 billion.

title: MBTA police seek woman who allegedly assaulted man on Green Line
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: MBTA Transit Police seek public help to identify woman accused of assaulting a man on Green Line.
Suspect allegedly punched a 71-year-old man and used pepper spray at Prudential station on February 17.
Authorities classified the case as assault and battery with a dangerous weapon; anonymity for tipsters is offered.
